thread.title: How a Bill Belichick prankster is inspiring one NFL rookie
thread.title_full: How a Bill Belichick prankster is inspiring one NFL rookie | New York Post

author: Justin Terranova
title: How a Bill Belichick prankster is inspiring one NFL rookie
text:
Cameron Meredith’s phone rang, and it was Bill Belichick with the most important news of his life: The Illinois State receiver was about to be selected by the New England Patriots at the end of the third round of the NFL Draft.
Until he wasn’t.
“The person called and said they were [Bill] Belichick and it was near the last pick of the third round,” Meredith told the Chicago Tribune. 
“The guy said, ‘We’re taking you with the next pick.’ ”
Meredith recalled to the paper how he watched in shock as the Patriots took Geneo Grissom out of Oklahoma with the 97th pick.
“They had the second pick in the fourth round the next day, and so I was thinking, ‘OK, maybe it is tomorrow,’ ” Meredith said.
But after his agent made some calls, they realized he was the victim of a Belichick impostor. Meredith would not be selected by the Patriots or any other team in the 2015 draft. Instead, he signed with the Bears as a free agent.
It’s worked out well for both sides. Meredith has showed promise with playing time made necessary by the depleted Bears receiving corps. He had four catches in Week 5 against the Chiefs, including two clutch ones as the Bears rallied to an 18-17 victory.
“That just fueled the fire for me even more right there,” Meredith said. “I wanted to make it.”
